definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: When the right heart was involved, it looked like "walking stick head" or "snakeheads".
sentences.chinese: 累及右心腔時可見似“柺杖頭”或“蛇頭”狀改變。

sentences.english: All the while, Ping was learning about the "snakehead" organised crime group that owned her.
sentences.chinese: 漸漸地，劉平了解了擁有她的蛇頭組織犯罪集團。

sentences.english: The woman said, 'The serpent tricked me, and I ate.
sentences.chinese: 女人都打蛇頭，蛇則咬女人的腳跟。

sentences.english: Fujian police arrested 242 human smugglers last year.
sentences.chinese: 福建警方去年共逮捕了偷渡蛇頭242名。

sentences.english: So called "snakehead" gangs have beenresponsible for smuggling thousands of illegal migrants out of China into HongKong every year.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的“蛇頭”團伙每年把數千人非法移民到香港。

sentences.english: He is a white collar coyote. He also did money laundering.
sentences.chinese: 他是個專做白領偷渡的蛇頭，他也犯有洗錢罪。

sentences.english: They shall strike at your head, and you shall strike at their heel.
sentences.chinese: 女人都打蛇頭，蛇則咬女人的腳跟。

sentences.english: We paid a coyote ten thousand bucks a piece to get us in to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 我們每人都付了一萬美元給蛇頭帶我們進到美國。

sentences.english: I heard Michael yipe as he came across the snakehead fish.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見了麥可碰到蛇頭魚時的驚恐聲。

sentences.english: One need never go wanting for anything in America, the snakehead says.
sentences.chinese: 蛇頭說，在美國，他們想得到的一切，應有盡有。

definition: to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
